title: smartmike88
author: smartmike88
content: Hi I have my metamask wallet private key which is 64 characters long but not the subwallets which have been lost.I dont have the seed phrase for the main wallet. Just the private key of the parent/main wallet. Will I be able to recover any of the subwallets or generate a seed key from the main private key in order to recover the sub wallets.I do remember that you could add additional wallets assuming you had the main seed key to generate all lost wallets - unfortunately I do not have the seed - just the main private key of the number one wallet.

comments.author: dansus021
comments.body: One private key is for one account only if you creating second wallet on metamask they have their own private key as far i know. But one private key can be used on multiple chain like eth bsc polygon iotex avax fantom ec and their token

comments.author: shinratensei_
comments.body: So you can't see the rest of your wallet. Have you downloaded the keystore? If you are only having a privatekey for your wallet and this is only related to the one address but if you have no seed and you will not able to open the rest of address that already contained in your seed. You must know your seed to be able to open your wallet.

comments.author: erep
comments.body: I'm also assuming one private key is just for my address/wallet and it doesn't work to recover all the addresses that are already stored, but if you select a seed phrase there's also no guarantee it can be recovered as experience has happened to me. However, I don't know if importing the keystore file will work to restore the entire wallet completely.

comments.author: capedbaldy
comments.body: Quote from: shinratensei_ on May 18, 2022, 07:20:32 AMSo you can't see the rest of your wallet. Have you downloaded the keystore? If you are only having a privatekey for your wallet and this is only related to the one address but if you have no seed and you will not able to open the rest of address that already contained in your seed. You must know your seed to be able to open your wallet. Based on the OP's statement that it doesn't store other than private keys, so I agree with the above opinion that there is no hope of returning all other wallets apart from the one that can be recovered from the private key that the OP has stored.

comments.author: mdzahed134
comments.body: I think if you have also seed phrase then even you can't recover all of the wallets those are created in the metamask or trust wallet. Only one private key/seed phrase/keystore file to access for one wallet, so as i know that there are no way to restore all of the sub wallets by one seed phrase.
